title: Girls' Shoes
question_text: The graph below shows the distribution of the number of shoes for a group of $37\text{  girls}$ . Which of the following choices BEST estimates the mean and standard deviation of the distribution? Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.

choices.text: The mean of the distribution is around 20 pairs of shoes 20 pairs of shoes with a standard deviation of around 13 pairs of shoes 13 pairs of shoes .
The mean of the distribution is around 13 pairs of shoes 13 pairs of shoes with a standard deviation of around 20 pairs of shoes 20 pairs of shoes .
The mean of the distribution is around 9 pairs of shoes 9 pairs of shoes with a standard deviation of around 3 pairs of shoes 3 pairs of shoes .
The mean of the distribution is around 30 pairs of shoes 30 pairs of shoes with a standard deviation of around 25 pairs of shoes 25 pairs of shoes .
The mean and standard deviation cannot be estimated because the distribution is not nearly normal.
